intro: Astracantha drusorum, commonly known as the mountain holly. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae, characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture for its dense foliage and seasonal blooms.
